Reviews.Title: “Fire death-trap”
Reviews.Author: Susan M
Reviews.Content: It is a firetrap! I booked 3 nights in room #36 in March of 2012. Left my bags and went out for dinner (once I figured out how to get out of the building). Came back to the tiny room (2 twins separated by a non-working fireplace) and tried to shut the window. There was no heat or a/c controls, and the TV didn't work - despite taking the remote twice to the management. Basically, I sat up all night hoping there wasn't a fire as there was simply no escape. I politely let the management know that there was no way in hell I was staying another night in that place (along with a line of similarly disgruntled guests). After taking enough pictures to prove my point, I left so fast that I left some things behind. I took pictures of the window that was permanently jammed half-way open, along with the toilet paper in the hall. They informed me that despite the conditions in the room that they were charging me for another night. They also 'misquoted' the price saying that the new girl who was working did not know what she was doing. Worst hotel of my life. I believe it should be shut down.

Reviews.Title: “marnix”
Reviews.Author: Nina K Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very good location, but very noisy hotel. room is very small. We booked a double with private bathroom, it was 4 beds, bat there is no any wardrobe and only one bedside table

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: NoelPeek
Reviews.Content: I was scared to death before I came after reading the reviews about rats in the rooms. However, I did not see or hear any of these little creatures! I stayed in a 10 person dorm and was pleased to find clean towels for free. Breakfast is 5 euro, but there is a fridge and microwave and I indulged myself with cheap supermarket food instead. It's a stones throw away from Leidsplein, and easy walking distance from all touristic places. Only one outlet in the dorm room (which is a problem) but you can charge things outside in the lobby area as well. For being the cheapest place I found on the weekend, I really did not expect anything decent, but I'd definitely go back for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: Amy P Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: very clean and airy. nothing like a kettle or toiletries but its budget and didnt expect it anyway. friendly helpful staff. comfortable and warm had a tv in the room too which we weren't expecting. has a variety or english and dutch channels. only problem we had was the doors. they are very heavy and a couple of times a night when people came back to the hotel, they'd slam the door and it woke me. if you're on a budget i'd definitely recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “What you would expect from a Cheap Hotel/Hostel”
Reviews.Author: oliverwoods1988
Reviews.Content: A group of 4 of us went to this hotel for 2 nights over NYE and booked before we had set off. We all knew booking at last minute and with a low star hotel what we had let ourselves in for. The hotel is as you would think, great location, bunk beds, reasonably helpful staff, Tiny Toilet, Leaky Shower & Stuffy room. But we had a good time and its somewhere that if push came to shove we would stay there again. We did find a few things that made us laugh about room 204. A piece of toast (non buttered) stuck to a side board and a TV in the top right of the room that had a wire hanging down but not plugged into anything, just to clarify the room didnt have any plug sockets in so the TV was kinda useless.... Good Trip!!

Reviews.Title: “What can you say? Poor to Average Rating”
Reviews.Author: ChepstowBob
Reviews.Content: I did my normal trick, booked before reading the reviews. I was horified at the reviews, so i will give you my normal honest account. The staff were polite and helpful. Well I stayed for 3 nights 24th to 27th December for a christmas break. So here goes; stayed on the third floor in a two bed ensuite. Firstly the 51 steps up there was a nightmare, very steep and narrow. The room was 10 feet by 10 feet and the bathroom was very tiny; shower, toilet, and very small wash hand basin (cold water only). the bathroom was so small I couldn't reach the basin without straddling the toilet! but it was clean. The room was clean also and serviced everyday with clean sheets and towels. No tea/coffe making facilities and no cups either. When I asked for on I was given a paper coca cola cup. Also no bed bugs or mice in sight. As for the stealing of personal goods, I did over hear somebody complaining at reception and asking for the police. I had taken the precaution of locking my suitcase after reading the reviews. Now, wait for it!! on the last morning I went for my insulin injection and you won't believe it, six insulin pens had been taken from my medical bag. Luckily I had a pen in my jacket pocket to tie me over until I returned to the UK that evening. To sum it up. Clean and livable in. If you have trouble with stairs in any way give it a miss. As for security, thats nil, as the accomodation is in a seperate building with the same key card to enter the building and your room. (Does that mean everybodys key opens all doors, never heard of a dual card before?) By the way the twin beds was a bunk bed!!! Location was good and transport was easy with the trams. Would I stay again? No! Would I recommend you to stay? No! Not even the price would tempt me, it was cheap for Amsterdam but definitely not worth it for quality or hassle. I would have stayed in the Hotel where I stayed before had it been available. You can read my previous review of that one. The breakfast was ok for 5 Euros, normal continental breakfast. But it did feel like like you were eating in a factory canteen. The place probably doesn't merit the horrendous reviews it has had, I did see some other rooms, as the cleaning was going on, on the way past. My advice choose somewhere else, or you will get what you have paid for. Regards Bob

Reviews.Title: “Got what we paid for - 10 BED DORMA”
Reviews.Author: Ryan M
Reviews.Content: We arrived as a bunch of 8 guys for a stag holiday, so we booked out in advance the big room with 8 beds. However on the day of arriving there they were unable to give us this room, but after some complaining at the desk gave book us out for the 10 bed room, which was more than acceptable. The facilities where poor admittedly but considering how cheap they were offering i think it's more than acceptable for the price. As I said in the title, generally you'll get what you pay for, and this couldn't be more so true in the case of the Marnix Hotel. The 10 bed room is not clean when we arrived, but they sorted out that eventually plus the room was at a slight / tilt. The location is really good, as it's literally outside the main square which was really good. If you're after a cheap bed to sleep in for the night, I think this hotel is right down your alley, but if asked whether i'm going back.

Reviews.Title: “Much better than expected by older reviews”
Reviews.Author: kimlon
Reviews.Content: Probably the mice checked out when I checked in, haven't seen any. The reception told me they got a professional exterminator to kick them out. It's located in the center of Amsterdam, 200 meters from Leidse Square. Plus the staff was helpful telling me information what to do and where to go. It's seems that the hotel is renovated, we had a total different experience than mentioned before by other guests! Some people here write that the stairs are too steep - duh! It's Amsterdam! The building is 140 years old! Yes, the stairs are steep and if you don't like that, maybe find another town to visit... Just a thought.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap accomodation - but strange and "mousey" ! Avoid ROOM B2!”
Reviews.Author: marcowegleiter
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in this hotel and the first one was horrible. When we arrived the room looked pretty clean and quite nice. Later we noticed, that the windows don`t close, so it became really cold inside (It was only 10 Â°C outside!) and the sounds of the street were noisy. When we came back from going out, I had a chocolate muffin with me, it was wrapped into paper bag, maybe there fell some crumbs out.. So when we tried to sleep we started hearing some strange noises... !! After a few mins we realised it was a mouse nibbling at something.. later we realised it was NOT ONE MOUSE, it were like 10 MICE (!!!!!!!!) jumping around in our room, in our luggage, EVERYWHERE.. they where crawling in the BEDDING BOX enjoying 2 human radiators haha :D .... so my boyfriend went to the reception and after complaining we got another free room immediately. They guy at the reception was really understandable and told us that "they knew from problems in room B2" - so IÂ´m just wondering why they still try to rent this disgusting mousey room!! It was also strange that there where no people except us in our floor.. all rooms where empty.. There was a kitchen including a fridge available for all guests - unfortunately the oven wasn`t useable, because there where no pots or pans, no cutlery, no glasses. The fridge was stuffed with old food :( and the sink with dirty dishes :-/ In one corner there where 3 mousetraps! Last but not least a few positive things: + friendly staff + cheap accomodation + comfortable beds + clean bathroom and toilets + the room intself was clean

Reviews.Title: “Very disgusting Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bart W
Reviews.Content: I will first start with the (only) positive thing about this hotel: the location. It's just 200m from the Leidse Square. So everything is in walking distance from the hotel (Rembrant Square, central station, the dam, Museum Square, Red light district etc,...) Now the "less" positive side: The reception of this hotel is in another building 100meters across the street, which is a bit odd. But it's not that far, so ok. In this building is also breakfast. The reception room is a bit old, but still ok. After checking in we went to our room. First there are very, very steep stairs (no lift). Certainly when you are on the 3rd floor. Very difficult to walk upstairs with a suitcase. But still, no big deal. Then the room! Very old and dirty. The beds were very old, but we were lucky to have our own toilet and bathroom (as many didn't have). But that room! I wonder why this hotel may stay open! Is there no inspection? Went out into the city and in the evening when we returned we saw there were all bugs onto the bed!!! Luckily we came for the Amsterdam Dance Event so we went out for party. But in the morning I didn't go for a sleep in this bed!!! So we stayed up and went in the city the next day very tired. We also didn't go the breakfeast, After all this, I wouldn't take the risk. The lugage deposit is just were breakfast is, so total not safe! The hotel isn't expensive, but for the same price I slept in much better hotels in Amsterdam with the same great location!!!

Reviews.Title: “A place to rest your head”
Reviews.Author: Kirby G
Reviews.Content: Hostel was in a good location, but is purely somewhere to rest you head, beds are comfy and linen is provided, rooms are small, 1 shower & 1 toilet per level, so always a queue in the morning and never any toilet paper. Was one of the cheapest places to stay in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Average, decent, not too expensive.”
Reviews.Author: silvericemaiden
Reviews.Content: Good location, near plenty of cafes, 'coffeeshops' and restaurants. There is a huge live music venue - Melkweg. It is a fairly lengthy walk (20-30min) to where the action is (Red light district and the square). The hostel itself has breakfast for a fee, but you can borrow cutlery and use their fridge and microwave. There is no oven, cooktop, or any other cooking facilities however. There are heaps of stairs, no elevators. Staff were nice, and gave us a 3 bed room instead of a 6 bed room for one night when they had big groups in. Don't keep your room card in your wallet, it de-magnetises the card, and won't open the room anymore. No laundry facilities. Wifi Internet is available for free in the lobby/breakfast area, and there are paid computers and printers. They store your luggage in the breakfast area (unsecured) for the day if needed when you check out. One toilet and shower per floor, which can get busy. The shower is just a room and you can't keep anything dry in there, everything gets wet. Overall a decent hotel for the price.

Reviews.Title: “If you value your life stay somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: alisonmili
Reviews.Content: We had booked a 3 person bedroom in hotel de lantaerne. When we drove up to the hotel it redirected us to the marnix hotel to check in across the road.The staff were rude , blunt and the "hotel lobby" looked more like a run down hostel. We stated we were there to check into the other hotel and handed the myhotel booking confirmation numbers. We checked in and paid and then were directed up these steep filthy staircase to a stinky sub standard hostel room. The room was not what was pictured in any of the advertisings or online. The room had items left behind from previous occupants in it, the toilet seat was not attached to the toilet, the carpet was dirty and the place smelt like bodily fluids, the tv was mounted on the wall but didnt have a cord long enough to reach the power socket,. there was hair in the sink and on the foor and the room had obviously not been cleaned or maintained since last millenium.We went and complained to the desk that A. this wasnt the hotel we had booked at. B. the hotel was really a hostel and filthy at that . He offered us another room on the second floor to try and smooth things over however when we got in there ... the room was almost identical, there was still drink cans in there from the last people, the room was filthy, the TV didnt work. We went out for dinner and on return it was apparent that someone had been in the room as the lights were turned on and the window had been closed. I also noticed bugs on the bed and that was my breaking point. i grabbed my bag and fled the room to check out only to be notified there would be no refund. THIS HOTEL IS A SCAM!! its not what is states, its run by unscrupulous people with no conscience for poor unsuspecting customers who paid super high prices of 315 euro for 2 nights accomodation. DONT STAY AT THIS PLACE !!! i would rather risk the street than stay there its safer!!! RUN PEOPLE RUN>>> DONT BOOK HERE

Reviews.Title: “This was terrible!”
Reviews.Author: aphdejong
Reviews.Content: I can almost write a book about what was wrong here. Short: we didn't get the room we ordered, payed 95 euro's for a verry small room where the bed wasn't big enough, it wasn't cleaned, there were mice. the staff isn't helping and even don't speak Dutch (we are dutch ourselves) and not very good English. I don't have words anymore... this is just terrible. And i will make a case of it to get my money back (we payed before seeing the room and we didn't get our money back although we didn;t sleep there).

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting Hostel, Poor Service, Rude Staff”
Reviews.Author: honeypotant
Reviews.Content: This place may seem like a good price, but don't fall for it. This is the worst hostel I've ever stayed at in Europe. The floors were sticky, the bathrooms smelled terrible, and the showers leave you feeling dirty. Our keycards were deactivated several times per day, and they only give you one keycard even if you are renting out multiple beds. The thing that really pushes this hostel to the level of disgusting is that the staff were exceptionally rude. They always seemed pleased by the fact that we were dissatisfied with our stay. I left the room to go to the bathroom at 5AM only to find that my keycard had been deactivated. I checked to see if the reception was open to reactivate it, and it was not, even though the front desk is supposed to be open 24 hours. Another guest had to let me into the room. When I told a staff member in the morning what had happened, he told me that it was "not possible" with a huge smile on his face, assuring me that there was always someone there. I guess I just imagined it.

Reviews.Title: “Awful!”
Reviews.Author: krishna8922
Reviews.Content: 3 of us paid 200 pounds for this hotel room for 2 nights. We checked up a few sites and the photos of the hotel from the internet and it seemed good. However upon arrival at the hotel, we had to agree that we were cheated. The hotel was a dorm! They gave us a double decker bed and a single bed for the 3 of us and a shower room. Guess what, it was a public toilet for the whole floor of about 15 people. The toilets were never cleaned and the rooms were so cramped and dirty. The point is I paid quite a bit and got rubbish service, never stay in this Dorm!Totally rubbish!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible service and just plain mean receptionist.”
Reviews.Author: Sanne92
Reviews.Content: I was backpacking with two of my friends on a low budget last summer. Our final stop was Amsterdam (which is an amazing town!) and our room at Marnix Hotel was booked and already paid for. We had some complications with the room, which we had already paid for (not just a deposit, but the whole deal). We were offered a new room, if we could pay extra. But usually, if the hotel makes a mistake they do not charge their costumers for it so we refused and said that we could be moved to another room, but that we would not pay extra. After that we were yelled at to the point where we actually were scared (three girls at the age of 17 and 18), we asked for the manager, but he would not call him. We then decided that we could not bare to stay at that hotel and asked for a number to the nearest hostel/hotel but he refused to help us and "kindly" asked us to leave. This was around midnight and we were on the street in an unknown city and we didn't know where to go. It was kind of like a worst kind scenario, but luckily we met several dutch people and other tourists that helped us find a new hostel. I don't know what could have happened if not, our luggage might have got stolen or even things that I do not wish to think about... Amsterdam is a lovely town, but this experience almost ruined our stay there. It was really, really awful.

Reviews.Title: “Grossest hostel in Europe.. No on the planet”
Reviews.Author: Beckyliu
Reviews.Content: I stayed here and it was the biggest mistake of my life. Words can't suffice to describe how disgusting this place is. Try bed bugs? And talk about bathrooms smelling like port-o-potties! I felt really gross about sleeping on the beds, not to mention they were horribly uncomfortable. Finally, if that's not a deterrent the receptionists are terrible and have never heard of the term "good pr" they have now qualms with cheating a customer out of money whatsoever.

Reviews.Title: “Health And Safety Disaster Waiting to Happen”
Reviews.Author: la_1970
Reviews.Content: We have been to Amsterdam on many occasions previous to this weekend away and have stayed in some pretty basic Hotels, but the Hotel Marnix is far and away the worst Hotel we have ever stayed, be it Amsterdam or anywhere. The websites claim that the Hotel is in the heart of Amsterdam (Dam Square, Red Light District etc). It is nowhere near any heart of anywhere, just nestling on the outskirts of the maps you pick up from hotels and bars tells you exactly how far from the main drag it actually is. We got there at around 1pm. only to be told we couldnt check in till 2pm, fair enough we thought as it does state this when you book. The receptionist told us 1 of our rooms (we booked two) was almost ready and if we came back at 2pm, all would be well and hopefully the other room would be ready as well. On arriving back to the Hotel, we were informed only 1 room was ready, the other one would be ready in the next hour or two. Too cut a very long story short, we got back to the hotel at around 5pm, only too be told there was no other room available to us and we had no option but to share the 4 bed hotel room with our daughter and her partner.As you can imagine, not exactly ideal !! The room itself was disgusting, mould on the walls, shower only working when you held it, no lock on toilet door, old socks under one of the beds (??!!!) only made the experience even more disgusting. The people who worked behind reception were uninterested at best, down right rude, mannerless and deliberately awkward at worst. Amsterdam is still a wonderful, enchanting and vibrant city, but a strong word of warning, Before you book flights on the spur of the moment, check hotel availability, because every chance you will have to end up staying at the Hotel Marnix and if this is your first experience of Amsterdam Hotels, you just might make it you last.

Reviews.Title: “Bizarro world?! The room is actually really nice!”
Reviews.Author: javierlopez40
Reviews.Content: When I read the reviews, this hotel doesn't really give confidence for a decent stay. But when I checked in, I was really surprised with this hotel. The room looked really nice and looks renovated with freshly painted walls and wooden panels on the wall. The carpet also is clean and spotless and the beds were comfy. Reception told us that they were busy with renovating the place and our room was already done, so I guess we are lucky. Regarding the location, this is perfect with bars, clubs and restaurants just around the corner and the museums within 5 minutes. Also wifi is free, so that saved me a lot of money! It could be that the old situation was really bad, but in my opinion the Marnix Hotel now is a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “They steal people's belongings in rooms”
Reviews.Author: pauljvm
Reviews.Content: DO NOT stay in this "Hotel" by any means.. They still people's belongings while they're out of their rooms. They give spare keys to thieves who go into rooms stealing people's stuff. It happened to me 2 weeks ago. Plus, they're not responsible for anything. The receptionist know who the robbers are but they don't say anything.

Reviews.Title: “Amsterdam is Great! I will be back”
Reviews.Author: SanjeyLicht
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Amsterdam for Christmas and a few more days. We booked in the Marnix hotel because it was cheap. When we got there i cannot believe the room, it was not like the pictures they were renovated! we got a room on the third floor for the three of us, first we thought it was a bit dusty, but when we got our room it was sooo nice for the price :) They told us we are lucky since the low price with the new price!! Happy happy me! We will be back! Sanjey!

Reviews.Title: “Without a doubt, worst hotel (if i must call it that) of my life.”
Reviews.Author: fsotoma977
Reviews.Content: This is the first time I have ever been insulted and almost assaulted by a receptionist in a hotel. Here is the story in a nutshell: My friends and I came back from a night out in Amsterdam at what must have been 12 or 12.30am; a reasonable hour I would think (at least for a hotel). The problem was that we weren't able to get into our room because the main door of the hotel building had been locked. One of our friends had returned to the hotel earlier than us that night seeing as though she was feeling tired and wanted to get some rest. The receptionist didn't have keys to the second building (this is where they accommodate guests in case there are too many people in their main establishment) because, according to him, he had already used the key once to let one of the guests of our room in (ie. our friend). Thus, in an attempt to understand this ridiculous situation of a receptionist telling guests he is unable to open the door to the hotel, we insisted that he call someone or do something to let us in. After about 5 mins, the receptionist starting insulting us and telling us that we find ourselves another solution (maybe he meant another hotel, throwing stones at the window, attempt to climb up to the 4th floor or who knows..). When I told him I would go talk to the police he decided to get off his lazy posterior and feebly threatened me with his funny accent (actually, at the time I was crapping in my pants thinking my night would end in a fight). CONCLUSION: IF YOU WANT TO GO TO A HOTEL (one of those where you actually sleep on a bed, you can come back anytime you want, etc.) TRUST ME, this is the last place on earth you want to go.

Reviews.Title: “This is not a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CurtisBerkshire
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel as it sounded good of what I read but it was my worse hotel we have ever stayed in. Reception in one of the building and you have to walk about 4 other buildings before you get to the room. Toilet was filthy and the bathroom/toilet did not even had a shelf where you could put your things and even worse no toilet paper and if you needed any you would have had to get dress and walk down to the reception which is further down the road. People were unfriendly and when we were there all the guests were complaining how dirty the place was. I would not classify this as a hotel or hostel but just as a run down house which is badly looked after. I would never recommend anyone about it. I booked 4 nights but stay only one night and end up going to another hotel where it was much cleaner and friendly people. What you see online as nice picture of rooms and reception it is NOTHING like it, it's a real dump. Curtis Family - Berkshire

Reviews.Title: “Dusty”
Reviews.Author: jackinwriting
Reviews.Content: Its a hostel, so you cant expect too much. And I have stayed in some rough ones - but Marnix is a little too dusty for me. On the bedsheets and everywhere really. There was also a cat that prowled over a sparse selection of cereals offered for "breakfast" - which unsupprisingly i never ventured to try. It'll do, I suppose!

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, stressful, overall pain”
Reviews.Author: lozlucky7
Reviews.Content: My boyfirend and I booked a mini break to Amsterdam and found the Marnix Hotel as a last minute cheap deal. Initially we were really pleased, exhausted by the time we got up the stairs to our room on the 4th floor, but hey all places in Amsterdam are likes this! We were a bit confused as our booking stated that we were to share a bathroom with one other room. Once we got to our room we found out we were sharing with 3 other rooms. Also the "free wifi" that is avaliable with the hotel only works in the reception area. Ok not that a big a deal, was a bit miffed but nothing to cry over right? The first night's sleep was very uncomfortable and both my boyfriend and I woke up the next morning to be covered in bed bug bites. This was very uncomfortable and we were left itching till we forked out for bug bite relief at a nearby chemist. Tried to just ignore it, make the most out of a bad situation till i saw a dead cockroach on the stairwell. Was quite grossed out but just assumed that it was a one off. Boy was I wrong. Got back to our room and found a cockroach at leat 7inches long on our wall. I was absolutely fuming so ran down all four flights of stairs and got the reception guy to come and get it out (after sarcastic remarks from him as to how big he probably was until he saw it and started swearing saying he was scared). I was so angry and demanded to be moved to another room as it obviously wasn't clean if they had cockraoches. He said he could move us to a different room the next day which being fair he did although did shake us up and didn't get a very good nights sleep. I do agree that at the end of the day it is somewhere to rest your head after a long day wandering round beautiful Holland but i still wouldn't recommend it to anyone. Be warned! Lol.

Reviews.Title: “Get a grip people, it's not THAT bad!!!”
Reviews.Author: CharleneMoorhen
Reviews.Content: I've just come back from a 3 night stay @ the Marnix Hotel in Amsterdam. I was pretty worried beforehand, because of all the bad reviews I'd seen on here- particularly the pictures of bedbugs!!!! But it was all booked and paid for, and we were hardly going to be in the room anyway, so I didn't try and change it. Check-in was ok, the guys @ the desk were a bit unfriendly, but not rude as such... The room was up 2 flights of stairs (I can't believe some people on here have moaned just about this??)..... Yes, the room was VERY small, but the beds and sheets were all clean (trust me, i checked them alllllll over!!), and each guest had a fresh towel. We were also lucky to be right near the cleaners cupboard, so could open that and grab some more if we needed. To be honest, for a weekend that you're not going to be in the room much, you're just sleeping, what more do you need? Yes the rooms are small, the plaster is falling off the walls, and the window frames need repainting, but if you're going to Amsterdam to look at that, and sit in the room, then you're not going for the right reason at all. Cheap. Clean. Central. Happy Days

Reviews.Title: “Great cheap accomodation in good location with no rats or bedbugs!”
Reviews.Author: Oliver_GManchester
Reviews.Content: Just returned to UK from Amsterdam where we stayed at the Marnix. for 2 nights (25th -27 June). After booking beds for 17 people in two 4 bedded ensuite rooms, one 3 bedded ensuite, and one 6 bedded room at a cost of 47euros per person for both nights (by far the cheapest we could find in Amsterdam), a few of the guys came on here and read some of the shocking reviews about the hostel involving bed bugs, rats, steep stairs(!!!!) and poor facilities. However on arrival we were completely suprised with the quality we got. Yes the beds were a little squeezed in to the rooms but what do you expect for the price? And to be honest for a stag weekend to Amsterdam we weren't exactly going to be sleeping much anyway. The rooms themselves though were clean, the sheets were clean, beds comfy and fresh towels each day. The bathroom facilities were also surprising (in a good way), being extremely clean and the showers always with hot water and briliant pressure (no crappy dribbly thing that we were expecting). The communal toilet was again clean and loo rool plenty (you'd be surprised how many hostels I have stayed in where this is very scarce!!!). The hostel is in a brilliant location too, there are two bars opposite which were perfect to use as a meeting poing at the start of the night, Leipesdein square is a 2min walk around the corner with its bars (showing all sport), restaurants, and fast food outlets. Shops are also in this area along with tram stops etc that will take you all over (we didn't use this facility though as we just walked everywhere). Distances to other places: Main shopping street - 2 min walk Rembrandt Square - 10min walk Red Light District - 20 min walk All in all the hostel was extremely good value for money, clean, and great location. I would recommend staying here if you are looking for a hostel.

Reviews.Title: “Dont even think about going there, we got bitten by bed bugs!!”
Reviews.Author: xxg2bgizmoxx
Reviews.Content: The marnix hotel was the worst hostel ever! We arrived the first day and they greeted us kindly and led us to a building across the street. We had to climb narrow stairs, with all our luggage. Room 36: dont even go in there. The first night we spent in that room we were sleeping with little bugs that looked like tiny cockroaches. Those little roaches ended up being bed bugs. My friend and I have a million little bites because of those stupid little bugs and because of the stupid marnix hotel which is disgusting in so many ways. Anyways that night we went to complain at the lobby and they told us they would clean our room and blah blah. The next day we go back to a "cleaned up" room and the same thing happened that night. The little bed bugs came back to feed on us some more. We complained again and they gave us another room. A tiny room with a bunk bed. At night, I was scared for my life. NEVER EVER EVER EVERRRRR STAY AT THIS HOSTEL UNLESS YOU LOVE INSECTS, RATS, TERRIBLE BREAKFAST, UNSANITARY ROOMS, SUPER CRAZY NARROW STAIRS, OR IF YOUR FOND OF BEING SUPER ITCHY.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible disgusting unhygienic never again..”
Reviews.Author: dawn1982
Reviews.Content: We booked a 6 bed cheap budget hotel for amsterdam so we could spend our money on other things we got there at 10am and the man told us to come back in 4 hrs. we went back and the guy told us our room was now ready but took us back outside and pointed to the building opposite and said thats were our room was. We was in the basement with our room right opposite the toilets which smelled absolutely horrible, we opened the door and it was 3 concrete walls and a makeshift wall which you could see into the next room, there was 8 beds, no carpet, the plug socket was hanging off, no mirror or sink, the light was that dim we could hardly see each other, the curtain has been stuck up with some sort of rope and was hanging over half of the window, the beds are exactly the same as prison beds (so the guy who we was with told me), so we endured it for the first night but in the morning we couldnt hack it anymore so we got dressed and went back over to the marnix to complain, they apologised but didnt give us any explanations and said we could move into a 6 bed room in the hotel which was clean and basic but with a big window, bright light and a mirror and sink. I dont know if they were just trying to con us because we are all young but i wouldnt recommend this hotel to anyone. there are lots of hotels around that area that arent that much dearer, whatever that hotel is opposite it needs to be shut down, it definately wouldnt passed any inspections..............

Reviews.Title: “20 Euro a night !! Can't complain with that !!”
Reviews.Author: Bouncing-Monk
Reviews.Content: I was one of a party of 9 on a stag doo, this hotel was booked outside my control, at the airport and on the flight i started hearing the horror stories about this place. The hotel was what you'd expect for the price, we just needed a bed, IF YOU EXPECT MORE GO ELSEWHERE, coz that's all you get. Lets face it the reviews for this place isn't good but having stayed there for 3 nights i WOULD go back again. Bad points - shower has a mind of its own hard to keep a steady temp, our mini drawers had been kicked in, toilet seat was in place but not attached, no lift and steep narrow stairs, mouse traps in room (no sign of a mouse though!), toilet water was a funny colour, my bed had a leg missing (interesting experience) All these things were not a problem for us as we just needed a bed, but people should know what to expect, at 20 euros a night a was surprised we even got sheets. Good points - Clean sheets (inspected very closely), clean towels, en-suite rooms, blackout curtain, Internet in reception, vending machines on site, spare shower and toilet on landing, breakfast included (quality unknown), 5 mins walk from Leidseplein, 20-30 mins walk from dam square (or 7mins on tram), coffee shop directly opposite. I hope this has been of some help to at least one person, its a very honest review on a hotel that really doesn't deserve the reviews it gets.

Reviews.Title: “Crappiest hotel in life history”
Reviews.Author: kayque
Reviews.Content: - Paid cash 50 eur a night. Crappy hotel, dirty carpet in room, stains on the bed cover sheets, toilet not working properly, leaves remains when flushing including toilet paper, stains on shower curtain, wall and floor (may get an mushroom, foot infection because of the dirtyness) small tv with lousy quality. Clothing cabinet looked like an outside bathroom with rats living in it. Giant hole on the side of the floor facing away from bed. Hard bed!!! The whole hotel room was shaking everytime the bus went by, Window not properly sealed could hear people whisper outside. + Nice hotelstaff

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for â‚¬ 20,00 p.p. incl. breakfast !”
Reviews.Author: Shaun_Delcour
Reviews.Content: We knew it was a cheap hotel so we did not expect much ! It was good enough for its price. The best thing about this hotel was that it's not far from "leidseplein' ! The place 2 be if you want to go out and have some fun ! If you want to eat some good pizza not far from the hotel, then you def. have to go to pizzeria fantasia ! They are also very friendly...

Reviews.Title: “Did the Job for a Lads weekend away”
Reviews.Author: DanDeerskin
Reviews.Content: This "hotel" was booked by a friend on behalf of the group, and was booked due to it being the cheapest in the city, so I wasn't expecting much! Not the worst Hostel I've stayed in and the fact that Breakfast was included in any form was a big plus. The rooms are standard, not the cleanest with some stains and a dingy bathroom, however the staff were friendly and the provision of internet was a positive! The Hotel is placed on a major tram route however is a good bit out of the city centre, a good 30 minute walk for us folk who would rather drink our money than spend it on trams!

Reviews.Title: “Staff was really nice, but BUGS”
Reviews.Author: adamseau55
Reviews.Content: The staff at Hotel Marnix went out of their way to accomodate my friends and I. However, their pleasant demeanor did not make the hundreds of nats that lived in our hostel room go away. Also the floor in the bathrooms were perpetually wet and gross. I wouldn't mind staying there, however, if you bring women I wouldnt recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “ewwww. run for your life!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: mtnlibrariantraveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel had the distinction of being the most expensive hotel I've stayed in and the worst. Central American jails come to mind. Holes in the ceiling, Mold on the floors and walls and around the shower, dirty sheets, Mice or rats, Extremely cramped. An endangerment to my 2 children. Noisey clientele up at all hours, drunk and obnoxious. There was no soap available. The desk clerk said they were out and could maybe get us some the next day. We were booked for 2 nights and had to leave after the first. For this we paid 200 euros per night, and forfieted our last night there for our health and safety. Breakfast was a joke!

Reviews.Title: “It was OK, but don't expect much”
Reviews.Author: luchy1309
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a great location, is close to everything! The rooms are quite small, and have bunk beds. It is and looks old. The staff is nice and helpfull. The bathroom was not very clean. It was expensive compared to what you received. The breakfast was nice and unexpected.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap & nasty hostel. It's not a hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Merrilies
Reviews.Content: My main problem with this place was that my bed sheet had blood on it - not a stain, not brown, but fresh red! How I didn't notice this until the 3rd night I don't know. I then changed the sheet for another in the room. The room was insecure- At the top of the room was an opening into the next room which could easily be climbed into. It should have been blocked by mesh but was broken. This also meant we could hear everything next door and vice versa. Could hear people across the corridor too - especially when they started talking at 3am and smoking tobacco. With no window this was a problem, it's also illegal. Woken by people coming back at 5am another night. You can hear every footstep. Floor dirty- curling carpet tiles. However the showers were good. I booked a twin room, we were given a 3 bunk bed dorm room in the basement for our sole use- no window, but that didn't make much difference as the whole place was covered in sheeting. Had trouble finding it as the whole place was covered in scaffolding and sheets! Extremely cheap 12.50 Euros pppn, I see this has gone up to 25 Euros now and no way would I be happy paying that with the experience I had. Breakfast ok - help yourself mad scramble. You get what you pay for but you'd also get this if you pay 25 Euros!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely and Clean - Recommended”
Reviews.Author: ziamatt
Reviews.Content: Ignore the bad reviews in here!! There's no such bad things happen. Its a nice Cheap Hotel. The staff is very helpful and great breakfast. The room and toilet - tidy and very clean. The location is very strategic, near public transport and the surrounding area is awesome. Recommended to stay here. Will look forward to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “What a dive...comfy beds though”
Reviews.Author: caillin_deas
Reviews.Content: My God people! We got a twin 'room'..more like a closet! Now when we read reviews of this place my friend and I thought people were being picky. But really, we were on the top floor, that was 5 flights of stairs and no lift! The sink in our room was blocked with ash and tobaco (non smoking 'hotel' it is not) and every time we brushed our teeth the water wouldn't go down but the crap stuck in it it. We had to share the shower and toilet with the whole floor. To be fair, the shower was nice and clean and always hot. The toilet was gross. People were getting sick into it all weekend and it was NEVER cleaned. I had to resort to cleaning it as much as I could myself before I used it (bleach was left above the toilet but never used). Every morning at around 10am the cleaners would knock on all of the doors asking if you were leaving. Really annoying. The hotel is in the middle of the party district which is good if you like that. Also it is walking dist (less than 10-15mins) away from Van Gogh and Reick Museum and the Anne Frank House. It's on a good tram route to town (â‚¬1.60). I think the only good thing about the place was that the beds were comfy!!

Reviews.Title: “I saw the mouse”
Reviews.Author: bendodds
Reviews.Content: I read loads of reviews about this place, so I had prepared myself for the worst. It really wasn't that bad, and for the price it was really good. The Leidseplein is only a 2 minute walk away, and there is a coffee shop accross the street called crush, which is really good. We had the 8 bed room and 2 other rooms in the hotel, and even though there was a mouse we weren't that bothered. It nibbled through my friends time out bars, and my other friends penguin bars, but nevermind. The mouse is white by the way. The bathroom in the 8 bed was tiny, and if you were to sit down on it your legs would be touching the door, but that was part of the charm. The staff were alright, and the 24 hour reception thing is really good. The breakfast was alright too, and there are drinks available all day from the lobby. There is a computer for internet access too which was handy. If your just looking for a place to crash at night its perfect, its not the Ritz but you shouldn't expect it to be at the price it was.

Reviews.Title: “never ever again!”
Reviews.Author: ganitou
Reviews.Content: Hi there My giflfriend and I are not people who need a lot of comfort but these hotel is defenitely never ever again our choice of staying...My girlfriend stayed allready ones at this hotel before, but like she said, everything has changed to the worse. We spent 4 nights during eastern in amsterdam. fortunately we stayed only several hours in the hotel for sleeping. First of all, too expansive during eastern, every day the costs are rising, from 25 to 45 â‚¬ a day per person for a 6 bed room, without windows, no air, very small and dirty. the boss, a really nevervous, unfriendly lier. the only one's they were friendly were the cleaning staff. every day we were asked coming to the receptionist, cause they had no organisation about who is how long staying. After the first night we need to change the room (from a 3 bed room, which was not really bad) to our booked 6 bed room. day after they thought we had to pay for all days we have allready done on arriving day. unneeded discussions! last but not least...boycot these hotel without thinking you miss a hotel with good condition, it isn't!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Mouse in the room???”
Reviews.Author: Littoral
Reviews.Content: Positive : Breakfast was very good. Negative : The room was extremely small. The shower cleanliness was bad. We had towels: that's great. But, I prefer to don't have when all the towels have a BIG hole. In our first room, the window didn't close properly. AND... when we check out, we realise that our chocolate has been bitten by... we don't know. It was big bit like a mouse. Where was our chocolate for all the stay... in a bag on the ground of our room. I will never recomend this hostel to any body.

Reviews.Title: “The only kind thing you can say is that it's clean”
Reviews.Author: mmerlin33
Reviews.Content: This was a pretty horrible hotel. We were booked into the Fantasia Lucky Travellers hotels for four days, but they had double booked our room so we were transferred to here for two nights. First they ripped us off - charged us â‚¬100 a night when the advertised rate is â‚¬68. The room was pretty as basic as you can get - two single beds, two bunk beds (in a room for two - it's an odd place). There was an en-suite shower and toilet, but nothing else at all - no chair, no table, no phone, no lamp - nothing. They really are stretching two-star beyond breaking point. The room dÃ©cor was just nasty - orange walls with a rough texture and incredibly dim light. The room was not touched in any way between day one and day two - no clean towels, no making of beds - the only thing done was to remove one towel to take us back to the one towel that we were given between two people on the day we arrived. The included breakfast was a very minimalist affair - orange juice or water, toast or you can make yourself a toasted sandwich from slices of processed cheese and very cheap ham. If I've made it sound appetising it isn't. The staff were generally acceptable, except for one receptionist who seemed defensive and unconcerned. Finally the walls are paper thin so you can hear everything that every other room does. Basically avoid at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and nice!”
Reviews.Author: AMMorais
Reviews.Content: The beds and towels were clean, the carpet on the floor I don't know because they were dark, but i don't care either. Yes, there was no bathroom inside the rooms but there were 1 per floor and I've always found them clean. The rooms were small, but i've slept there for 4 nights and had the time of my life! The showers are apart from the bathrooms and were in good condition too. I found it cheap and nice! The owners and good people, the breakfast is good. I would definitly stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Never Go There !!!”
Reviews.Author: Piittt
Reviews.Content: First, I had booked a room with toilets but there were no toilets in the room and no room available with toilets (futhermore, there were no light in the shared toilets) . After 20 minutes of very hard negotiations with the owner, we obtained the possibility to cancel the booking, leaving the hotel on the following day and beeing reimburse. Second, I have travelled in many places in the world and in some very cheap hotels in under-developped countries, but I had never seen a such filthy hotel : dirt everywhere and worse : wastes, empty bottles and food under the beds. At last, it's a very noisy location : tramways in the street, snores from the adjoining rooms... NEVER GO THERE !!! For the same price, you can find so much nicer hotel in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Will Never do it again”
Reviews.Author: Tom29
Reviews.Content: We have booked 2 six-bed rooms, but although the bookings proceeded normally, when we arrived, the reception told us, they donÅ¥ have the booked rooms. They had only one 6 bed room and one 4 bed room, so they put there 2 matraces inside on each room for some price reduction. The rooms were really small and awful. I haven't ever seen anything like this accomodation! And the social facilities-1 shower on the floor for appr. 20 people was inside the bath, so You had to wait until all the people finish cleaning their teeth or you could exhibate. Generally the "bath" was terrible, dirty and disgusting. The only average thing was the breakfast, but all the rest was about 1-2/10points. I thing that if you want to save some money, go to Formula1 or s.l.t. but trying to sleep at this hostel is really adventure for itself. Tomas

Reviews.Title: “More of a youth hostel than a hotel”
Reviews.Author: Redcloudy
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a weekend in Amsterdam where I spent two nights at Marnix Hotel with 5 friends. Since it was all booked last minute we did not have much choice as far as accomodation was concerned. But we're all former backpackers in our thirties now and decided it would be fun to re-live that dorm-room experience. Since one of us is pregnant though, we asked if the room had a private bathroom. We got a very nice answer saying, yes, of course the room has a private bathroom. As we got there we first had to make it to the third floor: the steepest and narrowest stairway I have ever seen! The room was about as big as my home bathroom (and I live in a small flat) with three bunk beds, no room for our bags (even very small ones) and NO BATHROOM. One of my friends had printed out the booking e-mail and made her way back down to complain only to be told that dorm rooms have no en suite bathroom and that since they're all booked out and all Amsterdam is booked out we would just have to make do...Since it was supposed to be a fun weekend we decided to laugh about it and adjusted but I still think at a 150 euros per night it was a rip-off. Had we known we would have just gone for a hostel that calls itself a hostel: at least we would have known what to expect! One last thing: the "breakfast room" is the tiny lobby which fits about 10 people. If like most of us you get up between 9 and 10 forget about finding a chair...we decided to splurge and went for the breakfast buffet at the American CafÃ© (just 5 minutes up the street) were you can sip champagne and eat all you can for 20 euros!!! All in all the Marnix Hotel is a youth hostel, the room and shared bathroom were clean and the beds comfortable. If you simply need somewhere to sleep and everywhere else is booked out, go for it. If not take the time to look for something decent (Hotel Sint Nicolaas by the main station, where we were allowed to leave our luggage FOR FREE finding the storage room at the station full, seemed very nice).

Reviews.Title: “Decent and cheap”
Reviews.Author: laconikz
Reviews.Content: For its price, the Marnix Hotel is decent. The location is good, the breakfast is free and goodsized. Nevertheless, the hotel is also understaffed, so donÃ¤t expect to check in on time. The cleanliness is also subpar, but if you've gone to Amsterdam for the right reasons, then it shouldn't matter anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Stig of the Dump”
Reviews.Author: amoresperros
Reviews.Content: Stayed at hotel marnix over the new year period. Left it too late to get a cheap nice hotel so stayed here. It was the cheapest at 80quid a night but if it was any other time of the year id say its worth about 15quid a night. Ideal mybe for skint students and backpackers. Room was dreadfull, bed the size of a coffin, no telly, no towels for the shower, tiny tiny room, window only openend slightly, walls were dirty and painted a century ago. Theres a busy street outside with trams going through the night and bright street lights. On the bed all you get in a thin sheet and a scritty thin blanket plus 1 really flat pillow. Saying all this we had a great time.. we arnt fussy and only stayed in room when we were unconscious. I wouldnt come here unless you are skint or just planning to get hammered and pass out really late then leave asoon as you wake up.

Reviews.Title: “Not so cheap, low quality, very basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Johnny4043
Reviews.Content: The hotel was comparatively cheap, but it was ugly, uncomfortable, and very low key, ideal for smoking and not much more. Not the place to enjoy your room. The only good things were its location near the Leidseplein and the friendliness of some of the personnel.

Reviews.Title: “Very centrally located!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel was easy to find and not too far from Central station.Friendly 24 hour reception.Our room was clean and functional, with nice clean sheets and towels.There are soap dispensers on the wall next to the sink in the room and also in the shower. The bathroom was nice and clean but did smell a bit musty but there wasnt a window in the bathroom.You can get hot and cold drinks from the reception area.This hotel is very central and you are minutes from fantastic entertainment, shopping,the cafes,fast food and excellent restaurants.If you are here to shop, chill or whatever and need somewhere simply as a base then this hotel is ideal.I found it value for the money as everywhere else within the same price range was way out of town.Please email if you want anymore details.

Reviews.Title: “very good one”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: ok, for a two stars budget hotel this is a perfect place. we stayed there for four nights. at the last two we were upgraded to a bigger room which was equiped with own shoer and toilet. very clean and enough for waht we expected. they have rooms wish shared facilities which are smaller but for few night at the city, these were good as well. the staff were great, friendly and helpful. they sent us the see the tourist attractions and the the right clubs. all in all we cabn recoment this hotel. Ton & Jane Dublin.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting rip-off”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is the sort of dump where you definately want to leave your socks on while walking around the room. Filthy bed linens, cigarette butt left on windowsill and `stuff' on the carpets. No soap in bathroom. And at 100 euros, you'd at least expect breakfast to be included, which it wasn't. Then again, considering how disgusting the place was, I'm not sure I'd trust the food. All-in-all a disgusting rip-off.

Reviews.Title: “Fine.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marnix mid September 04. The location was good, the room was clean, the staff was friendly. The room was tiny. There were two single beds on either side of the room with a narrow path between them and a sink at the end. The shared toiled and shower were clean.

HotelInfo.Name: Marnix Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Marnixstraat 382, Amsterdam 1016 XX, The Netherlands
